intro: Faramea quercetorum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are usually pink, purple, or white, and are borne in inflorescences at the leaf axils.
